Text

One [Enzo There]256-enzo comes a day in [a man]196-a man ’s life when [he]196-a man enters [a room]197-a room with hope in [his]196-a man heart and a ring in [his]196-a man pocket , fully prepared to get down on one knee . To pledge [his]196-a man eternal devotion . To take [[his]196-a man soul mate]198-his soul mate ’s hand in [his]196-a man and pop the question , promising to love , honor , and cherish [her]198-his soul mate forever and ever , until death do [them]199-them part , amen . This was not that day . However , [I]1723-tate did have a ring in [my]1723-tate pocket — a very nice one - point - four carat diamond solitaire on a gold band . [I]1723-tate ’d gotten a great deal on it because [[my]1723-tate cousin]200-my cousin [Paulie]43-paulie worked at [the jewelry store]201-the jewelry store , and [some poor guy]202-some poor guy had just returned it . Sure , it was engraved with [someone else]203-someone else ’s name , but [Paulie]43-paulie had assured [me]1723-tate that could be removed . In hindsight , [I]1723-tate probably should have done that before [I]1723-tate proposed . But [I]1723-tate was n’t thinking straight — [I]1723-tate needed [a wife]204-a wife , and [I]1723-tate needed one fast . It was all because of this ridiculous tradition in [[my]1723-tate family]205-my family . In order to inherit the family construction business , [Moretti]44-mr. moretti & [Sons]206-sons , [the oldest son]207-the oldest son has to be “ settled down ”[207-the oldest son] with [a wife]204-a wife and preferably [a kid]208-a kid or two by the time [he]208-a kid ’s thirty - five . [[My]1723-tate father , who was sixty - eight years old and ready to retire]209-my father , who was sixty - eight years old and ready to retire , had been threatening to leave the business to [[my]1723-tate younger brother]210-my younger brother [Pietro]1062-pietro for years now . [Fucking Pietro]1062-pietro ! [He]1062-pietro might be thirty - two and married with [his]1062-pietro third bambino on the way , but [he]1062-pietro was never on time , [he]1062-pietro was always disorganized , and [he]1062-pietro was way too easygoing to be [an effective manager]211-an effective manager . [Contractors]212-contractors , [suppliers]213-suppliers , and [clients]214-clients were constantly walking all over [him]1062-pietro because [he]1062-pietro hated confrontation . Do n’t get [me]1723-tate wrong , [he]1062-pietro ’s [[my]1723-tate kid brother]210-my younger brother and [I]1723-tate fucking love [the guy]1062-pietro — and [[my]1723-tate niece]215-my niece and [nephew]216-nephew are awesome — but [he]1062-pietro ’s not [the one [you]218-you want running [your]218-you multi - million - dollar firm]217-the one you want running your multi - million - dollar firm . [Me]1723-tate ? [I]1723-tate loved confrontation . [I]1723-tate was n’t afraid to tell [someone]219-someone when [they]219-someone were fucking up or remind [them]219-someone of the price [they]219-someone ’d quoted or the deadlines [they]219-someone ’d agreed to . [I]1723-tate knew when to be charming and when to be [a dickhead]220-a dickhead . [I]1723-tate knew when to be [a charming dickhead]220-a dickhead . And [I]1723-tate knew how to close a deal . At least , [I]1723-tate thought [I]1723-tate did . But that was before [I]1723-tate proposed . [I]1723-tate ’d been seeing [Reina]46-reina for about three months , which [I]1723-tate thought was a pretty decent amount of time to spend with [someone]219-someone , although [I]1723-tate might not be [the best judge of that]222-the best judge of that since long - term commitment has never been [my]1723-tate thing . Not that [I]1723-tate was a jerk about it — [I]1723-tate always made sure [a woman]223-a woman understood exactly what [I]1723-tate could offer [her]223-a woman ( one hell of a good time ) , and what [I]1723-tate could n’t ( anything resembling a relationship ) . But as thirty - five closed in on [me]1723-tate and [[my]1723-tate father]224-my father ’s threats started to get more real , [I]1723-tate realized it was time to [man]225-griffin up and put a ring on [someone]219-someone ’s finger . [Reina]46-reina seemed as good a candidate for [Mrs. Moretti]256-enzo as [anyone]227-anyone . [She]46-reina was [a little young]228-a little young — [she’d]46-reina just turned twenty - one yesterday , in fact — a little too attached to [her]46-reina phone , and sometimes [I]1723-tate had no fucking idea what [she]46-reina was talking about , but [she]46-reina checked all the other boxes for [me]1723-tate . [She]46-reina was beautiful , [she]46-reina was n’t crazy , [she]46-reina got along with [[her]46-reina family]229-her family , and [[her]46-reina mother]230-her mother was in [[her]230-her mother late forties]231-her late forties and still looked good . What more could [I]1723-tate ask for ? [She]46-reina checked [[my]1723-tate parents]232-my parents ’ boxes too : Catholic . Italian . [[My]1723-tate Nonna]233-my nonna knew [her]233-my nonna Nonna . Was [I]1723-tate in love with [her]233-my nonna ? No . But love was something that developed over time , was n’t it ? [I]1723-tate was n’t exactly sure , since [I]1723-tate ’d never been in love , but it seemed to [me]1723-tate like something [you]234-you settled into , like a couch that ’s a little stiff at first but grows more comfortable the more [you]234-you sit on it . [I]1723-tate figured [we]235-we ’d get there eventually . [I]1723-tate had n’t put all that blood , sweat , and tears into growing the business just to see it go to [Pietro]1062-pietro , and [I]1723-tate sure as hell was n’t about to be [the only oldest son in five generations who failed to inherit]237-the only oldest son in five generations who failed to inherit .
